results.title: The Myth of the Careless Worker
results.creator_credit: Victorian Trades Hall Council and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: This documentary/drama dispels the myth that industrial accidents are caused by careless workers, and the risks to the health and safety of workers are examined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victorian Trades Hall Council and Open Channel Productions

results.title: Living in Two Worlds
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face Australia”.
Looks at a suburban industrial “ghetto” in Wollongong which is made up almost entirely of migrants.

results.title: Finishing touches
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions and Kathy Mueller
results.brief_description: A film-noir style production that reverses the traditional roles of male detective/female victim, of the gangster genre. Written by Leslie Stern.

results.title: Eating your heart out [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Trout Films, Chris Warner and Maureen McCarthy
results.brief_description: Eating your heart out is about food, dieting, and obsessional eating, especially as they affect women and girls in Western societies. The film looks at four eating disorders: anorexia nervosa; bulimia; obesity; and a condition known as the fat/thin woman. It also examines the wider societal pressures on women that lead to these eating obsessions.

results.title: Understanding Cancer Pt.3
results.brief_description: This program is the final part of a three part documentary that looks at cancer. The program concentrates on the three main types of treatment that are offered to cancer patients - surgery, chemotherapy, and radiotherapy. Specialists in these fields discuss the treatments and when it is appropriate to use them.

results.title: Understanding Cancer Pt.2
results.brief_description: This program is the second part of a three part documentary that looks at cancer. Presented by Professor Richard Fox of the Ludwig Institute of Cancer Research, this program focuses on the disease from the patient’s point of view. The patients who appear in this documentary discuss their experiences with treatment and talk about their physical and emotional reactions.

results.title: Understanding Cancer Pt.1
results.brief_description: This program is the first of a three part documentary that looks at cancer. Presented by Professor Richard Fox, from the Ludwig Institute for Cancer Research, this program examines issues such as, what is cancer? and what causes cancer? Cancer specialists discuss these issues and comment on the influences of factors such as diet, environment and genetics.

results.title: ABN: the library without walls (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Canberra Media Productions and National Library of Australia
results.brief_description: An introduction to the Australian Bibliographic Network to non-librarians, and to librarians who have little knowledge of A.B.N. An introduction for courses either specifically on A.B.N. or on general on line services

results.title: More tricks than we have (TEFC)
results.brief_description: An introduction to how theatre in education works. Begins with a group of actors from Toe Truck Theatre and their director in the early stages of devising a play. We see the performance and follow up discussions and workshops. Based on the play “Year 9 are animals”, which tells the story of an enthusiastic first year teacher and the problems he encounters.
